about.label: About me
about.title: Technical background with an applied security focus.
about.paragraph1: I'm a software engineer in my final year of studies, with a two-year university specialization in applied cybersecurity. That journey let me integrate security best practices into backend work, authentication, and deployments without losing sight of the user experience.
about.paragraph2: I work on SaaS solutions, API integrations, and automation with Python and JavaScript. My security focus is practical: I design coherent systems with clear data flows and documentation that keep every delivery maintainable and lower risk.

kobra.title: Financial platform supporting Cybersur's daily operations.
kobra.paragraph1: Kobra is the tailor-made solution I built for Cybersur. With a stack of , it centralizes billing, collections, and notifications so the finance team works with coherent, up-to-date information.
kobra.paragraph2: Scheduled cronjobs manage exports and data cleanup, while alert pipelines log every action. The entire flow is designed to provide instant visibility and cut repetitive manual work.

bullets.first: Automated workflows that drastically reduce collection follow-up times.
bullets.second: Traceable cronjobs for exports and cleanup routines that keep data consistent.
bullets.third: Internal dashboards with the metrics needed to monitor payments and outstanding balances.

kobra.next: Next iteration: expand internal financial reports and automate reconciliations.
kobra.diagramContent:
Cybersur team
    ↓
FastAPI API → MySQL
    │
    ├─ Celery workers → Emails & reminders
    └─ Scheduled cronjobs → CSV reports

beatlist.title: Professional playlist management with Spotify's official seal.
beatlist.paragraph1: BeatList serves music lovers, curators, and creators who need more than Spotify's native manager. It combines advanced administration, discovery, and analytics in a fluid experience.
beatlist.paragraph2: Thanks to the official and approved authentication, the Flask backend accesses extended data with professional-grade stability. The JavaScript frontend offers dashboards and a web player with custom micro-interactions.

bullets.first: Playlist merging, cleanup, and reordering with intelligent rules based on metrics like energy or danceability.
bullets.second: Recommendation engine by favorite artists and genres, plus dashboards showing listening habits.
bullets.third: Celery-powered analyses process data in the background to deliver precise metrics without disrupting the user experience.

beatlist.next: Future evolutions: collaborative mode or insight exports in upcoming versions.
beatlist.diagramContent:
Web client
    ↓
Flask API (Spotify OAuth 2.0)
    ↓
MySQL → History & metrics
    ↓
JS dashboards + Player

mesasya.title: Smart reservations for restaurant chains.
mesasya.paragraph1: MesasYa is a production-ready SaaS that digitalizes reservations for multi-location restaurants. It offers granular occupancy control, automated communications, and dashboards tailored for managers.
mesasya.paragraph2: With as a base, the solution ships via Docker Compose with strong security practices, keeping workflows customizable per area, service, and team. Analytics and exports adapt to business decisions.

bullets.first: Interactive, configurable floor plans per venue, area, and service.
bullets.second: Automatic notifications for internal teams and final guests.
bullets.third: Exportable demand, capacity, and performance indicators for strategic decisions.

mesasya.next: Next steps: add automated reporting and keep improving the manager experience.
mesasya.diagramContent:
Staff & online reservations
    ↓
Flask API → MySQL
    │
    ├─ Celery workers → Emails & SMS
    └─ Docker Compose → Orchestrated services

mesasya.label: Case study 01
mesasya.title: MesasYa — Multi-location reservation SaaS
mesasya.paragraph1: MesasYa is a production SaaS that digitizes reservation management for restaurants with multiple venues. It combines interactive layouts, customizable rules, and real-time notifications so each service runs smoothly.
mesasya.paragraph2: The backend built with relies on Docker Compose and solid security practices. Each restaurant configures zones, services, languages, and workflows without losing stability or traceability.

bullets.first: Configurable floor plans with venue, area, and event rules.
bullets.second: Automatic table assignment and real-time alerts for staff and guests.
bullets.third: BI-ready exports and metrics that support business decisions.

mesasya.nextText: Automated reporting integration and smoother management experience.
mesasya.schemaContent:
Web / staff bookings
    ↓
Flask API → MySQL
    │
    ├─ Celery workers → Emails/SMS
    └─ Docker Compose orchestrates services

kobra.label: Case study 02
kobra.title: Kobra — Financial platform for Cybersur
kobra.paragraph1: Kobra keeps Cybersur's financial operations on track. It automates invoicing, collections, and reminders from a robust backend.
kobra.paragraph2: Scheduled jobs manage exports, data hygiene, and automatic reconciliations. Internal dashboards prioritize collection metrics and client SLAs so the finance team has day-to-day clarity.

bullets.first: Automated reminders and workflows that reduce overdue balances.
bullets.second: Traceable cronjobs and cleanup pipelines that keep data consistent.
bullets.third: Internal dashboards with collection and SLA metrics per client.

kobra.schemaContent:

    ↓
FastAPI → MySQL
    │

    └─ Cronjobs → Reports
